family.description: Force the download to both either Console (1) or Power (0)

removefileonexit.description: After an upgrade, remove the upgrade OS image

use_force.description: If set to True, the upgrade will happen even if the device doesnt need it.

doc.description: Set network interface parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

interface.description: This is the ethernet port name that is getting configured.

ipv4address.description: IPv4 format IP address for the defined interface Port.

ipv4dhcpdefgateway.description: Enable or Disable this ports configuration as the default IPv4 route for the device.

ipv4dhcpenable.description: Enable IPv4 DHCP request call to obtain confufuration information.

ipv4dhcpobdns.description: IPv6 DHCP Obtain DNS addresses auto.

ipv4gateway.description: IPv4 format Gateway address for the defined interface Port.

ipv4netmask.description: IPv4 format Netmask for the defined interface Port.

ipv6address.description: IPv6 format IP address for the defined interface Port.

ipv6gateway.description: IPv6 format Gateway address for the defined interface Port.

ipv6subnetprefix.description: IPv6 format Subnet Prefix for the defined interface Port.

negotiation.description:
This is the speed of the interface port being configured.
0=Auto, 1=10/half, 2=10/full, 3=100/half, 4=100/full, 5=1000/half, 6=1000/full

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.short_description: Set network interface parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices

wti.remote.cpm_interface_config.examples:
# Set Network Interface Parameters
- name: Set the Interface Parameters for port eth1 of a WTI device
  cpm_interface_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    interface: "eth1"
    ipv4address: "192.168.0.14"
    ipv4netmask: "255.255.255.0"
    ipv4gateway: "192.168.0.1"
    negotiation: 0

# Set Network Interface Parameters
- name: Set the Interface Parameters for port eth1 to DHCP of a WTI device
  cpm_interface_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    interface: "eth1"
    negotiation: 0
    ipv4dhcpenable: 1
    ipv4dhcphostname: ""
    ipv4dhcplease: -1
    ipv4dhcpobdns: 0
    ipv4dhcpupdns: 0
    ipv4dhcpdefgateway: 0

doc.description: Get network interface parameters from WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.)

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

interface.description:
This is the ethernet port name that is getting retrieved. It can include a single ethernet
port name, multiple ethernet port names separated by commas or not defined for all ports.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used

- name: Get the network interface Parameters for a WTI device for all interfaces

    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"

    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false

- name: Get the network interface Parameters for a WTI device for a specific interface
  cpm_interface_info:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    interface: "eth0,eth1"
    use_https: false

doc.description: Set network IPTables parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.

clear.description: Removes all the iptables for the protocol being defined before setting the newly defined entry.

command.description: Actual iptables command to send to the WTI device.

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

index.description: Index in which command should be inserted. If not defined entry will start at position one.

protocol.description: The protocol that the iptables entry should be applied. 0 = ipv4, 1 = ipv6.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.short_description: Set network IPTables parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices

wti.remote.cpm_iptables_config.examples:
# Set Network IPTables Parameters
- name: Set the an IPTables Parameter for a WTI device
  cpm_iptables_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    command: "iptables -A INPUT -p tcp -m state --state NEW -m tcp --dport 443 -j ACCEPT"

# Sets multiple Network IPTables Parameters
- name: Set the IPTables Parameters a WTI device
  cpm_iptables_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    index:
      - 1
      - 2
    command:
      - "iptables -A INPUT -p tcp -m state --state NEW -m tcp --dport 443 -j ACCEPT"
      - "iptables -A INPUT -p tcp -m state --state NEW -m tcp --dport 22 -j ACCEPT"

doc.description: Get and Set Plug Parameters on WTI OOB and PDU devices

cpm_action.description: This is the Action to send the module.

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

plug_bootdelay.description:
On a reboot command, this is the time when a plug will turn on power, after it has been turned off.
0='0.5 Secs', 1='1 Sec', 2='2 Sec', 3='5 Sec', 4='15 Sec', 5='30 Sec', 6='1 Min', 7='2 Mins', - 8='3 Mins', 9='5 Mins'.

plug_bootpriority.description:
Prioritizes which plug gets its state changed first. The lower the number the higher the priority.
Valid value can from 1 to the maximum number of plugs of the WTI unit.

plug_default.description: What the Plugs default state is when the device starts. 0 - Off, 1 - On.

plug_id.description:
This is the plug number that is to be manipulated
For the getplugconfig command, the plug_id 'all' will return the status of all the plugs the
user has rights to access.

plug_name.description: The new name of the Plug.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.short_description: Get and Set Plug Parameters on WTI OOB and PDU power devices

wti.remote.cpm_plugconfig.examples:
# Get Plug parameters for all ports
- name: Get the Plug parameters for ALL ports of a WTI Power device
  cpm_plugconfig:
    cpm_action: "getplugconfig"
    cpm_url: "rest.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "restpower"
    cpm_password: "restfulpowerpass12"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: true
    plug_id: "all"

# Get Plug parameters for port 2
- name: Get the Plug parameters for the given port of a WTI Power device
  cpm_plugconfig:
    cpm_action: "getplugconfig"
    cpm_url: "rest.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "restpower"
    cpm_password: "restfulpowerpass12"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    plug_id: "2"

# Configure plug 5
- name: Configure parameters for Plug 5 on a given WTI Power device
  cpm_plugconfig:
    cpm_action: "setplugconfig"
    cpm_url: "rest.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "restpower"
    cpm_password: "restfulpowerpass12"
    use_https: true
    plug_id: "5"
    plug_name: "NewPlugNameFive"
    plug_bootdelay: "3"
    plug_default: "0"
    plug_bootpriority: "1"

doc.description: Get and Set Plug actions on WTI OOB and PDU devices

cpm_action.description: This is the Action to send the module.

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device  to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

plug_id.description:
This is the plug number or the plug name that is to be manipulated
For the plugget command, the plug_id 'all' will return the status of all the plugs the
user has rights to access.

plug_state.description: This is what action to take on the plug.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.short_description: Get and Set Plug actions on WTI OOB and PDU power devices

wti.remote.cpm_plugcontrol.examples:
# Get Plug status for all ports
- name: Get the Plug status for ALL ports of a WTI device
  cpm_plugcontrol:
    cpm_action: "getplugcontrol"
    cpm_url: "rest.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "restpower"
    cpm_password: "restfulpowerpass12"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: true
    plug_id: "all"

# Get Plug status for port 2
- name: Get the Plug status for the given port of a WTI device
  cpm_plugcontrol:
    cpm_action: "getplugcontrol"
    cpm_url: "rest.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "restpower"
    cpm_password: "restfulpowerpass12"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    plug_id: "2"

# Reboot plug 5
- name: Reboot Plug 5 on a given WTI device
  cpm_plugcontrol:
    cpm_action: "setplugcontrol"
    cpm_url: "rest.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "restpower"
    cpm_password: "restfulpowerpass12"
    use_https: true
    plug_id: "5"
    plug_state: "boot"

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

port.description:
This is the serial port number that is getting retrieved. It can include a single port
number, multiple port numbers separated by commas, a list of port numbers, or an '*' character for all ports.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.description: Set Serial port connection/disconnection commands in WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.

action.description:
This is the baud rate to assign to the port.
1=Connect, 2=Disconnect

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

port.description: This is the port number that is getting the action performed on.

portremote.description: This is the port number that is getting the action performed on.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.short_description: Set Serial port connection/disconnection commands in WTI OOB and PDU devices

wti.remote.cpm_serial_port_action_set.examples:
# Set Serial Port Action (Connect)
- name: Connect port 2 to port 3 of a WTI device
  cpm_serial_port_action_set:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    port: "2"
    portremote: "3"
    action: "1"

# Set Serial port Action (Disconnect)
- name: Disconnect port 2 and 3 of a WTI device
  cpm_serial_port_action_set:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    port: "2"
    action: "2"

doc.description: Set Serial port parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.

break_allow.description: This is if the break character is allowed to be passed through the port, 0=Off, 1=On

cmd.description: This is the Admin Mode to assign to the port, 0=Deny, 1=Permit.

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

echo.description: -This is the command echo parameter to assign to the port, 0=Off, 1=On

handshake.description: This is the handshake to assign to the port, 0=None, 1=XON/XOFF, 2=RTS/CTS, 3=Both.

logoff.description:
This is the logout character to assign to the port
If preceded by a ^ character, the sequence will be a control character. Used if seq is set to 0 or 1

mode.description: This is the port mode to assign to the port, 0=Any-to-Any. 1=Passive, 2=Buffer, 3=Modem, 4=ModemPPP.

parity.description: This is the parity to assign to the port, 0=7-None, 1=7-Even, 2=7-Odd, 3=8-None, 4=8-Even, 5=8-Odd.

port.description: This is the port number that is getting the action performed on.

portname.description: This is the Name of the Port that is displayed.

seq.description: This is the type of Sequence Disconnect to assign to the port, 1=Three Characters (before and after), 2=One Character Only, 3=Off

stopbits.description: This is the stop bits to assign to the port, 1=1 Stop Bit, 2=2 Stop Bit.

tout.description: This is the Port Activity Timeout to assign to the port, 0=Off, 1=5 Min, 2=15 Min, 3=30 Min, 4=90 Min, 5=1 Min.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.short_description: Set Serial port parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices

wti.remote.cpm_serial_port_config.examples:
# Set Serial Port Parameters
- name: Set the Port Parameters for port 2 of a WTI device
  cpm_serial_port_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    port: "2"
    portname: "RouterLabel"
    baud: "7"
    handshake: "1"
    stopbits: "1"
    parity: "0"
    mode: "0"
    cmd: "0"
    seq: "1"
    tout: "1"
    echo: "0"
    break_allow: "0"
    logoff: "^H"

# Set Serial Port Port Name and Baud Rate Parameters
- name: Set New port name and baud rate (115k) for port 4 of a WTI device
  cpm_serial_port_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    port: "4"
    portname: "NewPortName1"
    baud: "8"

doc.description: Get Serial port parameters from WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.)

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

port.description:
This is the serial port number that is getting retrieved. It can include a single port
number, multiple port numbers separated by commas, a list of port numbers, or an '*' character for all ports.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

validate_certs.description:

on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.description: Set network IPTables parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.

authpass.description: Sets the Authentication Password for SNMPv3 (V3 only).

authpriv.description: Configures the Authentication and Privacy features for SNMPv3 communication, 0 = Auth/NoPriv, 1 = Auth/Priv (V3 only).

authproto.description: Which authentication protocol will be used, 0 = MD5, 1 = SHA1 (V3 only).

clear.description: Removes all the users for the protocol being defined before setting the newly defined entries.

contact.description: The name of the administrator responsible for SNMP issues.

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

enable.description: The activates SNMP polling for the specified interface and protocol.

index.description: Index of the user being modified (V3 only).

interface.description: The ethernet port for the SNMP we are defining.

location.description: The location of the SNMP Server.

privpass.description: Sets the Privacy Password for SNMPv3 (V3 only) (V3 only).

privproto.description: Which privacy protocol will be used, 0 = DES, 1 = AES128 (V3 only).

protocol.description: The protocol that the SNMP entry should be applied. 0 = ipv4, 1 = ipv6.

readonly.description: Controls the ability to change configuration parameters with SNMP.

rocommunity.description: Read Only Community Password, not used for SNMP V3.

rwcommunity.description: Read/Write Community Password, not used for SNMP V3.

systemname.description: The hostname of the WTI Device.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

username.description: Sets the User Name for SNMPv3 access (V3 only).

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

version.description: Defined which version of SNMP the device will respond to 0 = V1/V2 Only, 1 = V3 Only, 2 = V1/V2/V3.

doc.short_description: Set network IPTables parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices

wti.remote.cpm_snmp_config.examples:
# Sets the device SNMP Parameters
- name: Set the an SNMP Parameter for a WTI device
  cpm_iptables_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    interface: "eth0"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    protocol: 0
    clear: 1
    enable: 1
    readonly: 0
    version: 0
    rocommunity: "ropassword"
    rwcommunity: "rwpassword"

# Sets the device SNMP Parameters
- name: Set the SNMP Parameters a WTI device
  cpm_iptables_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    version: 1
    index:
      - 1
      - 2
    username:
      - "username1"
      - "username2"
    authpriv:
      - 1
      - 1
    authpass:
      - "authpass1"
      - "uthpass2"
    authproto:
      - 1
      - 1
    privpass:
      - "authpass1"
      - "uthpass2"
    privproto:
      - 1
      - 1

doc.description: Set network SYSLOG Client parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.

address.description: Sets the IP Address of the SYSLOG server to contact.

clear.description: Removes all the IP block entries for the protocol being defined before setting the newly defined entries.

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

index.description: Index of the IP block being modified.

port.description: Defines the port number used by the SYSLOG Client (1 - 65535).

protocol.description: The protocol that the SYSLOG entry should be applied. 0 = ipv4, 1 = ipv6.

secure.description: Defines if a secure connection is used by the SYSLOG Client (TCP Transport required).

transport.description: Defines the transfer protocol type used by the SYSLOG Client. 0=UDP, 1=TCP;

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.short_description: Set network SYSLOG Client parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices

wti.remote.cpm_syslog_client_config.examples:
# Sets the device SYSLOG Client Parameters
- name: Set the an SYSLOG Client Parameter for a WTI device
  cpm_iptables_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    protocol: 0
    index:
        - 1
    address:
        - "11.22.33.44"
    port:
        - 555
    transport:
        - 1
    secure:
        - 0

# Sets the device SYSLOG Client Parameters
- name: Set the SYSLOG Client Parameters a WTI device
  cpm_iptables_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    protocol: 0
    index:
        - 1
        - 2
    address:
        - "11.22.33.44"
        - "55.66.77.88"
    port:
        - 555
        - 557
    transport:
        - 1
        - 0
    secure:
        - 0
        - 1

doc.description: Set network SYSLOG Server parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.

address.description: Sets the IP Address to block message logging.

clear.description: Removes all the IP block entries for the protocol being defined before setting the newly defined entries.

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

enable.description: Activates SYSLOG listening for the specified interface and protocol.

index.description: Index of the IP block being modified.

interface.description: The ethernet port for the SYSLOG we are defining.

port.description: Defines the port number used by the SYSLOG Server (1 - 65535).

protocol.description: The protocol that the SYSLOG entry should be applied. 0 = ipv4, 1 = ipv6.

secure.description: Defines if a secure connection is used by the SYSLOG Server (TCP Transport required).

transport.description: Defines the transfer protocol type used by the SYSLOG Server. 0=UDP, 1=TCP;

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

wti.remote.cpm_syslog_server_config.examples:
# Sets the device SYSLOG Server Parameters
- name: Set the an SYSLOG Server Parameter for a WTI device
  cpm_iptables_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    interface: "eth0"
    protocol: 0
    port: 514
    transport: 0
    secure: 0
    clear: 1

# Sets the device SYSLOG Server Parameters
- name: Set the SYSLOG Server Parameters a WTI device
  cpm_iptables_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    interface: "eth0"
    protocol: 0
    port: 514
    transport: 0
    secure: 0
    clear: 1
    index:
      - 1
      - 2
    block:
      - "192.168.50.4"
      - "72.76.4.56"

doc.description: Set Time/Date and NTP parameters parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.

cpm_password.description: This is the Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Username of the WTI device to send the module.

date.description: Static date in the format of two digit month, two digit day, four digit year separated by a slash symbol.

ipv4address.description: Comma separated string of up to two addresses for a primary and secondary IPv4 base NTP server.

ipv6address.description: Comma separated string of up to two addresses for a primary and secondary IPv6 base NTP server.

ntpenable.description: This enables or disables the NTP client service.

time.description: Static time in the format of two digit hour, two digit minute, two digit second separated by a colon symbol.

timeout.description: Set the network timeout in seconds of contacting the NTP servers, valid options can be from 1-60.

timezone.description: This is timezone that is assigned to the WTI device.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.short_description: Set Time/Date parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices.

wti.remote.cpm_time_config.examples:
# Set a static time/date and timezone of a WTI device
- name: Set known fixed time/date of a WTI device
  cpm_time_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    date: "12/12/2019"
    time: "09:23:46"
    timezone: 5

# Enable NTP and set primary and seconday servers of a WTI device
- name: Set NTP primary and seconday servers of a WTI device
  cpm_time_config:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    timezone: 5
    ntpenable: 1
    ipv4address: "129.6.15.28.pool.ntp.org"
    timeout: 15

doc.description: Get Time/Date and NTP parameters from WTI OOB and PDU devices
doc.notes: Use C(groups/cpm) in C(module_defaults) to set common options used between CPM modules.)

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.short_description: Get Time/Date parameters in WTI OOB and PDU devices

wti.remote.cpm_time_info.examples:
- name: Get the Time/Date Parameters for a WTI device
  cpm_time_info:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false

- name: Get the Time/Date Parameters for a WTI device
  cpm_time_info:
    cpm_url: "nonexist.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "super"
    cpm_password: "super"
    use_https: false
    validate_certs: false

doc.description: Get/Add/Edit Delete Users from WTI OOB and PDU devices

cpm_action.description: This is the Action to send the module.

cpm_password.description: This is the Basic Authentication Password of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_url.description: This is the URL of the WTI device to send the module.

cpm_username.description: This is the Basic Authentication Username of the WTI device to send the module.

use_https.description: Designates to use an https connection or http connection.

use_proxy.description: Flag to control if the lookup will observe HTTP proxy environment variables when present.

user_accessapi.description:
If the user has access to the WTI device via RESTful APIs
0 No , 1 Yes

user_accesslevel.description:
This is the access level that needs to be create/modified/deleted
0 View, 1 User, 2 SuperUser, 3 Administrator

user_accessmonitor.description:
If the user has ability to monitor connection sessions
0 No , 1 Yes

user_accessoutbound.description:
If the user has ability to initiate Outbound connection
0 No , 1 Yes

user_accessserial.description:
If the user has access to the WTI device via Serial ports
0 No , 1 Yes

user_accessssh.description:
If the user has access to the WTI device via SSH
0 No , 1 Yes

user_accessweb.description:
If the user has access to the WTI device via Web
0 No , 1 Yes

user_callbackphone.description: This is the Call Back phone number used for POTS modem connections

user_groupaccess.description: If AccessLevel is lower than Administrator, which Groups the user has access

user_name.description: This is the User Name that needs to be create/modified/deleted

user_pass.description:
This is the User Password that needs to be create/modified/deleted
If the user is being Created this parameter is required

user_plugaccess.description: If AccessLevel is lower than Administrator, which plugs the user has access

user_portaccess.description: If AccessLevel is lower than Administrator, which ports the user has access

validate_certs.description:
If false, SSL certificates will not be validated. This should only be used
on personally controlled sites using self-signed certificates.

doc.short_description: Get various status and parameters from WTI OOB and PDU devices

wti.remote.cpm_user.examples:
# Get User Parameters
- name: Get the User Parameters for the given user of a WTI device
  cpm_user:
    cpm_action: "getuser"
    cpm_url: "rest.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "restuser"
    cpm_password: "restfuluserpass12"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: true
    user_name: "usernumberone"

# Create User
- name: Create a User on a given WTI device
  cpm_user:
    cpm_action: "adduser"
    cpm_url: "rest.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "restuser"
    cpm_password: "restfuluserpass12"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    user_name: "usernumberone"
    user_pass: "complicatedpassword"
    user_accesslevel: 2
    user_accessssh: 1
    user_accessserial: 1
    user_accessweb: 0
    user_accessapi: 1
    user_accessmonitor: 0
    user_accessoutbound: 0
    user_portaccess: "10011111"
    user_plugaccess: "00000111"
    user_groupaccess: "00000000"

# Edit User
- name: Edit a User on a given WTI device
  cpm_user:
    cpm_action: "edituser"
    cpm_url: "rest.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "restuser"
    cpm_password: "restfuluserpass12"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: false
    user_name: "usernumberone"
    user_pass: "newpasswordcomplicatedpassword"

# Delete User
- name: Delete a User from a given WTI device
  cpm_user:
    cpm_action: "deleteuser"
    cpm_url: "rest.wti.com"
    cpm_username: "restuser"
    cpm_password: "restfuluserpass12"
    use_https: true
    validate_certs: true
    user_name: "usernumberone"
